attributes.comment:
Our family would like to adopt children internationally. It is very difficult
because of the regulations concerning our required level of income, even tho we
are not on gov't assistance, and have not been for years. We do not meet the
income requirements, but have many assets. We would ask you to consider this
issue, as we have always managed quite well with what we have, feeding and
clothing and housing our children more than adequately. We desire to provide a
loving home to orphans. Please consider lowering the standard of "poverty level
income".
Also, there are many expenses in adoption, and certain documents sometimes
expire before the process is complete. We have witnessed this through friends
who are adopting. They had to get a joint sponsor to meet income requirements,
and were well into the process, when their home study, and other documents
actually expired due to no fault of their own. Still, they will complete the process,
though it created more expense and added hardship.
I am asking that you do not raise the fees of adoption any more, as it is
already difficult and costly enough for many of us who have a sincere desire to
help these children who are in desperate need of even a meal, let alone a home to
thrive in. Allow us the ability to help and to be blessed by these beautiful children.
Sincerely, Tina Puckett
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Tina Puckett
